free_text.Learning outcomes: This three-semester course series presents the basic concepts of classical and modern optics. It provides the students with tools for understanding and analyzing optical phenomena and designing various optical systems.

Propagation of Light[/b][br/]2.1 Principles of Huygens and Fermat[br/]2.2 Fresnel equations[br/]2.3 Superposition of waves[br/]2.4 Gaussian beams[br/][b]3. Polarization[/b][br/]3.1 Description of polarized light[br/]3.2 Dichroism and birefringence[br/]3.3 Polarizers and waveplates[br/]3.4 Propagation in anisotropic media[br/][b]4. Interference and Diffraction[/b][br/]4.1 Multiple-beam interference[br/]4.2 Diffraction theory[br/]4.3 Fresnel and Fraunhofer diffractions[br/]4.4 Interferometers[br/]
